metadata.title: 2018 Top Colleges for Foreign Languages
metadata.subtitle: in America
metadata.description: The Top Colleges for Foreign Languages list is based on key statistics and student reviews using data from the U.S. Department of Education. The ranking compares the top colleges that offer degrees in foreign languages in the U.S.

The ranking compares more than 1,000 top colleges and universities in the U.S.

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body:
Greenville, yes, is in the middle of corn fields in southern Illinois. But our campus contains such diversity that you run into people different than you all the time. Campus activities promote integration of all students, from athletes to bookish types, from African American students to South Korean students.
The one thing that many people are weary about is the lifestyle statement, which prohibits many of the 'typical college' activities (smoking, drinking, sex on campus, etc). As an RA, my interactions with the lifestyle statement have given me a broad perspective of the pros and cons of having such an agreement. As a Christian community I think it is imperative that we hold our students to a wholesome standard. However, for those students who do not practice Christianity, I have seen isolation and exclusion on occasion.
Overall, I love Greenville and am content with my choice for my educational advancement.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: My overall experience has been very good with the fact that my professors are personable and ready to help whenever asked. The students here are very kind and given that it is a small, private campus, everyone knows mostly everyone! The food here is really good as a catering service prepares the food, and they always have options. My only issue is with the dorms and the price of the dorms as I feel that I am paying more for what I am getting. Overall College of Idaho would be a great fit for anyone looking for a small school that offers multiple opportunities for their students.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Hiram College is a small college in rural Ohio. Hosting roughly 1000 students, there is always something to do on campus. However, it would be best for students to own a car since even the closest mart is 4 miles away in Garrettsville. As a nursing student, the academic demand is exceptionally high, and students that are not 100% devoted to their coursework quickly find themselves behind and some forced to drop out. The professors are caring and are willing to help students to the best of their ability. I could not have survived the first semester at Hiram without the help of my professors for sure.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I really love being a student at Mac!  The professors are all very helpful and sincere with wanting to help you understand the material.  The students are great!  I feel very lucky to be attending this college.  After a not so good High School experience, I have really excelled academically for the first time!  I really enjoy the whole experience and positive surroundings which I know all contribute to my current GPA of 4.0.  I am beyond happy.
